parameters.description: The identifier of this element used to reference it in other components
parameters.name: name

extensionModel.description: A module which provides functionality for compressing and decompressing data.

displayModel.summary: Compresses a set of entries into a new file in the specified archive format

operations.description:
Compresses all the given entries into a new file in the configured format.

Each entry passed to this operation will be placed inside the compressed archive with the name provided by the user in the DataWeave script. e.g.

For this expression:

{ file: vars.aTxtContent, 'dir/resume.pdf': vars.pdf }

The resultant archive will contain 2 entries one named "file" at root level and another one called "resume.pdf" inside a directory called "dir".

+- Archive | \- file1 | \+ dir1 | \- file2

As you can see in the example above, the slash "/" in the name of an entry indicates directory separation, so all names will be introspected to create dirs inside the archive.

parameters.description: the entries to be added to the archive
parameters.name: entries

parameters.description: The mime type of the payload that this operation outputs.
parameters.name: outputMimeType

parameters.description: The encoding of the payload that this operation outputs.
parameters.name: outputEncoding

parameters.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

description.value: This is the amount of memory that will be allocated in order to consume the stream and provide random access to it. If the stream contains more data than can be fit into this buffer, then it will be expanded by according to the bufferSizeIncrement attribute, with an upper limit of maxInMemorySize.

This is by how much will be buffer size by expanded if it exceeds its initial size. Setting a value of zero or lower will mean that the buffer should not expand, meaning that a STREAM_MAXIMUM_SIZE_EXCEEDED error will be raised when the buffer gets full.
This is the maximum amount of memory that will be used. If more than that is used then a STREAM_MAXIMUM_SIZE_EXCEEDED error will be raised. A value lower or equal to zero means no limit.
The unit in which all these attributes are expressed
Defines the maximum memory that the stream should use to keep data in memory. If more than that is consumed then it will start to buffer the content on disk.
The unit in which maxInMemorySize is expressed

This configuration allows the input stream to be read only once. It will not allow to seek randomly which will limit the transformations that DW can perform on this stream. Use this option for use cases which just require moving data around from one system to another to get optimum performance.

parameters.name: streamingStrategy

parameters.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed
parameters.name: target

parameters.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable
parameters.name: targetValue

operations.name: archive

displayModel.summary: Compresses a given content using an specific format

operations.description:
Compresses a given content using the configured format, ZIP or GZIP.

If a problem occur while compressing the content a COULD_NOT_COMPRESS error will be thrown.

parameters.description: the content to be compressed
parameters.name: content

parameters.description: the compression strategy
parameters.name: compressor

parameters.description: The mime type of the payload that this operation outputs.
parameters.name: outputMimeType

parameters.description: The encoding of the payload that this operation outputs.
parameters.name: outputEncoding

This is by how much will be buffer size by expanded if it exceeds its initial size. Setting a value of zero or lower will mean that the buffer should not expand, meaning that a STREAM_MAXIMUM_SIZE_EXCEEDED error will be raised when the buffer gets full.
This is the maximum amount of memory that will be used. If more than that is used then a STREAM_MAXIMUM_SIZE_EXCEEDED error will be raised. A value lower or equal to zero means no limit.
The unit in which all these attributes are expressed
Defines the maximum memory that the stream should use to keep data in memory. If more than that is consumed then it will start to buffer the content on disk.

This configuration allows the input stream to be read only once. It will not allow to seek randomly which will limit the transformations that DW can perform on this stream. Use this option for use cases which just require moving data around from one system to another to get optimum performance.

parameters.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

operations.name: compress

displayModel.summary: Decompresses a single entry compressed content

operations.description:
Decompresses a given single entry compressed content which is assumed to be in an specific format (ZIP or GZIP).

If the given content is not in the configured format an INVALID_ARCHIVE error will be thrown.

Compressed archives can have multiple entries, this operation can handle only single entry archives because if the archive would contain more than one the operation wouldn't know which should return, if the content has more than one entry an TOO_MANY_ENTRIES error will be thrown. For multiple entry archives use the `extract` operation of this module, which will let you choose only formats that accept multiple entries.

parameters.description: the content to be decompressed
parameters.name: compressed

parameters.description: the decompression strategy
parameters.name: decompressor

parameters.description: The mime type of the payload that this operation outputs.
parameters.name: outputMimeType

parameters.description: The encoding of the payload that this operation outputs.
parameters.name: outputEncoding

This is by how much will be buffer size by expanded if it exceeds its initial size. Setting a value of zero or lower will mean that the buffer should not expand, meaning that a STREAM_MAXIMUM_SIZE_EXCEEDED error will be raised when the buffer gets full.
This is the maximum amount of memory that will be used. If more than that is used then a STREAM_MAXIMUM_SIZE_EXCEEDED error will be raised. A value lower or equal to zero means no limit.
The unit in which all these attributes are expressed
